Key Match Events: The Clippers won 110-96 over the Mavericks in a preseason game, with Quentin Grimes leading the team with 20 points.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mavericks were without Luka Doncic and Kyrie Irving due to injuries, and P.J. Washington returned to the lineup after missing two exhibition games.
Post-Match Reflections: Mavericks coach Jason Kidd praised Derrick Jones Jr. for his consistent work ethic and professionalism.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks got an early look at this year's version of the Clippers and a sneak peek of Intuit Dome during the preseason game.
Others: James Harden will shoulder the burden of the offensive load for the Clippers this season, and Kawhi Leonard is recovering from offseason knee surgery.
New Teams/Players: Kevin Porter Jr. and Kai Jones joined the Clippers this season, and Klay Thompson is expected to contribute to the Mavericks.
New Arenas: The Clippers played their first game in their new arena, Intuit Dome.
Preseason: The Mavericks remain winless in preseason play due to injuries, but they'll host Milwaukee in their preseason finale Thursday.
Coaches: Mavericks coach Jason Kidd emphasized the importance of his team's consistency and work ethic.
